        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }

    filter: brightness(95%);

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    align-items: flex-start;

    font-weight: bold;

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <!----></span>r910752<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/910752"><!---->r910752<!----></a> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<span class="line"><!----> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<!----></span>issue 1243646<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1243646" title="Security: container-overflow in RecordEngagementMetric"><!---->issue 1243646<!----></a>) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <span class="line"><!---->) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <!----></span><br>This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <span class="line"><!---->This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }

          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {

          max-width: 1000px;

        }

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;

            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            position: static;
          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <!----></span>r910752<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/910752"><!---->r910752<!----></a> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<span class="line"><!----> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<!----></span>issue 1243646<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1243646" title="Security: container-overflow in RecordEngagementMetric"><!---->issue 1243646<!----></a>) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <span class="line"><!---->) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <!----></span><br>This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <span class="line"><!---->This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        mr-issue-page {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<!----></span>issue 1243646<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1243646" title="Security: container-overflow in RecordEngagementMetric"><!---->issue 1243646<!----></a>) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <span class="line"><!---->) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <!----></span><br>This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <span class="line"><!---->This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <!----></span>r910752<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/910752"><!---->r910752<!----></a> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<span class="line"><!----> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<!----></span><br><br>Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<span class="line"><!---->Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<!----></span>issue 1243646<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1243646" title="Security: container-overflow in RecordEngagementMetric"><!---->issue 1243646<!----></a>) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <span class="line"><!---->) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <!----></span><br>This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <span class="line"><!---->This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1234252: container overflow in Browser Process(PermissionUmaUtil::PermissionPromptResolved)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1234252: container overflow in Browser Process(PermissionUmaUtil::PermissionPromptResolved)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

            on 
      Thu, Jul 29, 2021, 1:35 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 29, 2021, 1:35 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <!----></span>r910752<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/910752"><!---->r910752<!----></a> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<span class="line"><!----> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<!----></span><br><br>Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<span class="line"><!---->Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<!----></span>issue 1243646<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1243646" title="Security: container-overflow in RecordEngagementMetric"><!---->issue 1243646<!----></a>) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <span class="line"><!---->) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <!----></span><br>This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <span class="line"><!---->This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/crash.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/crash.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/crash.html<!----></a><br>2. click "always allow popups"<span class="line"><!---->2. click "always allow popups"<!----></span><br>3. then refresh page again.<span class="line"><!---->3. then refresh page again.<!----></span><br>4. after about 20         Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <!----></span>r910752<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/910752"><!---->r910752<!----></a> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<span class="line"><!----> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<!----></span><br><br>Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<span class="line"><!---->Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<!----></span>issue 1243646<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1243646" title="Security: container-overflow in RecordEngagementMetric"><!---->issue 1243646<!----></a>) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <span class="line"><!---->) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <!----></span><br>This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <span class="line"><!---->This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the updated poc. I'm unfortunately unable to reproduce the crash on <!----></span>r910752<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/910752"><!---->r910752<!----></a> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<span class="line"><!----> ASAN build using the new crash2.html. After following the repro steps, I see a new tab get repeatedly opened and closed. The location chip shows a few times on the left of the Omnibox, and then the "location denied" icon shows in the right of the Omnibox. Letting it run for a few minutes no crash occurs.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this will affect things, since the ASAN builds are non-official chromium builds, but could you share the "Variations" listed in chrome://version for the browser that you're able to reproduce this in, just in case there is some feature state that we're missing? Are there any notable details about your system that you are able to repro this on?<!----></span><br><br>Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<span class="line"><!---->Otherwise, this may need to be a speculative fix by Permissions folks, which may take a bit longer, but the ASAN stack trace seems plausible so we should keep this open and investigate.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, the VRP Panel would like to extend to you a reward for $5000 for your report. While we do normally only reward the first reporting of a bug for duplicates of an issue with the same root cause, because the later report (<!----></span>issue 1243646<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1243646" title="Security: container-overflow in RecordEngagementMetric"><!---->issue 1243646<!----></a>) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <span class="line"><!---->) allowed the issue to be reliably reproduced, and root cause identified and resolved we have also rewarded and credited that report for this issue (as the fix was released in a security refresh of M93). <!----></span><br>This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <span class="line"><!---->This is a unique situation, so in the interest of fairness, we wanted to reward you for your efforts, but we also felt it was right to reward and credit the report that led to finding and fixing this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
